chat.msg: hola, you ready?
Hi! Ready!
cool! so, i'm at the starting point by this twig
what's next?

imagine you are on top of a clock. You see the numbers 1 through 12 and you are on the middle, the center of the clock. you have to go towards the number seven. This is the direction. You will cross the whole land and go where the big bird is, next to the elephant.
alright! i'm now by the parrot, the tree, and the elephant
where to now?
now you are going through the bridge made by three rocks and go to the frog
got it! here by the frog now, boss
where to next?
now you going to use the alligator as a bridge and go to the giraffe
made it to the giraffe without getting chomped! what's the next move?
you are going to cross the stick, pass the snake and the bushes. You are going to find the trunk with the treasure
¡Diablos, sí, encontré el tesoro! *finalizado*
¡esto fue divertido!

chat.msg: hola, q tal? ready to go?
Hi! Yes! ready

¡impresionante! Entonces, comienza moviéndote unos pasos hacia el oeste desde el perro blanco, pasa por debajo del banco de madera y cruza el sendero. Justo antes del puesto de floristería, gire en U bruscamente a la izquierda.
Ahora regresas hacia nuestro perrito blanco.
aqui estoy en el puesto de floristeria. Que tengo que hacer?
super! a continuación, cruzarás el sendero de nuevo, pero esta vez en dirección sur, pasando por encima de la rama
¿ves a otro perro blanco por allí? es nuestra próxima parada
donde esta el perro?
el perro está al sur, sentado junto a un mantel de picnic a cuadros rojo y blanco
dirígete hacia allí
aqui estoy en el picnic
perfecto! ahora, camina hacia el oeste por encima del mantel de picnic, rozando un tazón de bayas
ok
y ahora
brilliant! now you are looking for another branch of wood to cross the river, this time heading north
cool! ahora rodea el arbusto verde por la derecha; no toques el arbusto
sigue caminando hasta que llegues al puesto de flores
estoy en el puesto
very good! Now turn left, head west, under the post and follow the path until you reach a large bridge
Do you see two people on bicycles over there?
yes
brilliant! Now continue walking west, passing the bridge
done! what's next?
¡Frío! Nada más pasar el puente, ¿ves a dos ancianos sentados en un banco leyendo el periódico? En caso afirmativo, muévase un poco hacia el sur entre ellos y una rama de madera.
aqui estoy
very good work! Now you must find a green bush at the end of that trunk
You see it?
yes! i am on it
great, buddy! now go east, in-between the branch and that bush you are next to
ok
now, a few steps east and you will spot a young brown deer
stop once you see it

chat.msg: hola, you ready?
Hi! I am ready! are you ready? where are you?
hey! yup, all set
starting at the north, at the tent. where do i go from here?
perfect! you go south, towards the friendly dog. you will go around the dog towards east where you will find a fire
ok, passed the dog and reached the fire
now, should i go towards the mushroom or the car?
go around the fire, pass the mushroom and go to the car. Do not touch the car.
¡Llegué al auto y evité tocarlo! ¿que sigue?
vas a caminar para el sur usand el camino
¡excelente! Seguí el camino, ahora veo un telescopio.
¿que sigue?
contorne el telescopio y va en direccion a oeste. Hacia las piedras
oh, desti, i see the rocks and the wooden house beyond it
so, between you and me, am i near the finish line yet?
yes! You see the wooden house, all you have to do is go to its front porch and you are done!
breezed past those rocks, now i'm standing on the porch of the wooden house
*finished* we did it, team effort!

chat.msg: hola, you ready?
Ready! I am located at the palm trees
awesome! now stroll under the first palm towards the south-west. after that, veer to the right and cross the middle tree
before you reach the third palm, take a sharp left. keep heading south
done! what's next?
neat! you see that cute brown pup? walk a bit to its left, curve slightly left again, and then hook right going south
going towards the ocean?
¡Buena observación! Ahora, aprieta entre la roca grande a tu izquierda y la pequeña a tu derecha hasta que llegues al agua.
Ok!
Muy bien, ¡ahora viene la parte divertida! Sumérgete en el agua hasta que veas al Sr. malhumorado - el gran cangrejo rojo
luego gire a la derecha y siga por la gran roca. Quédate en el camino hacia el oeste en el agua.
y ahora?
well, after the medium rock, you'll spot a shark! don't panic! just make a sharp right turn as soon as you see it
towards the beach?
¡sí! regresa a la tierra pasando entre la roca mediana y esa llamativa bola con rayas azules, amarillas y blancas
Una vez que estés en la arena, dirígete hacia el norte.
ok
¡Sigue con el buen trabajo! ahora, deslícese ligeramente hacia la izquierda, en dirección noroeste
deberías cruzar entre una carpa roja y un altavoz súper grande
ok
y ahora?
estupendo! ahora, curva alrededor de la tienda como en un arco, luego dirígete sur hacia la orilla del mar
sigue el camino hacia el oeste justo por debajo de ese kayak rojo que estás viendo
no llegues al agua
ok aqui estoy
super
ahora date la vuelta hacia el norte, camina junto al kayak hasta que veas un pequeño arbusto verde. ¡y ahí lo tienes!

general_survey.answer: Yes. In the United States, Spanish is present everywhere.
general_survey.question: Have you ever lived in a home environment or country where your second language was spoken? If so, please explain briefly:
On a day-to-day basis, how likely are you to have a conversation using both your first and second languages?
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? At work
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? At home
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? Interacting with friends
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? Interacting with family
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? Using social media
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? To accommodate people who don't share the same language or language fluency.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? For social reasons; one language feels more appropriate.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? I can't think of a word in the current language.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? The word in the other language just fits better.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? It's an accident, or I don't realize I'm doing it.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? I'm more comfortable discussing the topic in the other language.
Do you enjoy mixing languages in conversation?

general_survey.answer: It shows that the person lacks a certain knowledge about the particular language.
general_survey.question: What do you think when others mix languages in conversation? Please explain:

general_survey.answer: English and Spanish came to my life together. I have been using them on a daily basis ever since.
general_survey.question: Any final comments about your language background?
